alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 1:34PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 368.0 feet, In Perry County, structures in the Crooked Creek Campground and Marina become inundated. Water also inundates portions of Blunts Landing Road south of Highway 412. Access may be limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Saturday the stage was 365.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM CST Saturday was 365.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 368.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
